title: Internal Auditing - Fundamental Principles & Concepts
headline: Learn how to conduct an internal audit using accounting techniques in this free online financial management course.
description: This bookkeeping course is designed for anyone looking to become an internal auditor or auditing professionals who want to refresh and polish their skills. This course's topics are straightforward and cover the essential aspects of internal auditing: its types, the process of conducting an internal audit and preparing an internal audit report. We also compare external and internal auditing. Sign up to take control of your organisation's finances.
courseDescription:
Auditing is a regular part of every organisation’s financial processes. Companies conduct these audits for various reasons, starting with the need to enhance efficiency and eliminate wasteful expenditure. However, these audits sometimes fail to produce the desired results and certain skills are required to make them fruitful and justify the expense and effort they demand. With this in mind, the experts at Exoexcellence Consultants have designed this course to help you conduct effective internal audits.

The primary aim of this course is to train students who aspire to become professional auditors in the future and to help internal auditing professionals who want to enhance their skills. The course consists of a single module with three topics. The first topic discusses different types of internal audits and compares internal and external audits. 

Our second topic then takes you through the steps of conducting an internal audit. We cover all the minute details and technical points that define this technical process. The course’s final topic explains how to prepare an internal audit report and present it to the company's management. We employ various graphics to make learning the complex aspects of auditing easier for you and our assessment offers an opportunity for you to practise your newfound skills. Sign up to enhance your accounting and bookkeeping abilities and learn how internal auditing can save an organisation money by identifying waste and preventing fraud.

Start Course Now

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Define internal audit and its various types.
    • Compare internal audits with external audits.
    • Analyze the process of preparing a draft and audit reporting.
    • Compute different ways through which internal audits can benefit the companies.
    • Evaluate all the processes of conducting an internal audit in detail.
    • Describe the method of preparing an audit summary and the role of working papers.
    • Discuss the essential components of an internal audit report.

  • Internal Audit

  • Internal audits assess a company's internal controls, including its corporate governance and accounting process. By conducting these audits, companies can ensure that.
    • They stay compliant with local laws and regulations.
    • They can maintain an accurate collection of financial data.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Moreover, internal audits also allow companies to get efficient operationally as they can identify their problems and correct them before they are identified in an external audit. Internal audits also effectively provide companies with a certain degree of risk management while protecting them from fraud and cheating. The management can also benefit from internal audits by giving them improvement suggestions.
  • What should be the Auditing Frequency?
  • Internal audits can be performed weekly, monthly, half yearly or yearly. Their audit frequency depends upon the types of departments and their functions. The organization defines the frequency based on its need. For example, they can audit the finance department more frequently compared with the HR department, which may require an audit bi-annually.

  • The Internal Audit Process

  • The internal audit process mentioned in the previous topic is explained here in more detail. As mentioned earlier, any organization preparing to begin auditing usually does so with planning. In this step, internal auditing team members come together and discuss all the required prerequisites for the auditing process. 

    This helps them stay aligned throughout the audit journey and complete the processes without disruptions. The next step is auditing. During auditing, various metrics from each company department are analyzed and compiled in a report. This report is then submitted to the top management. Afterward, the internal auditors can perform reviews from time to time and see if their suggested changes have been implemented in the reorganization or not. To elaborate on these four stages further, of the audit, we can take a look at the following elements:
    • Planning of the audit.
    • Announcement letter.
    • Initial meeting (preliminary survey, internal control review).
    • Audit program (fieldwork, transaction testing, advice, and informal communication).
    • Audit summary (working papers, discussion draft, exit conference, final draft, final report, response, comments).
    • Audit follow-up (follow-up review, follow-up report).

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Internal audits are beneficial to organizations in a lot of different ways. They can conduct these audits to identify modifications in their existing ways, identify any additional risks, and determine the organization's preparedness for external audits. Among the different components of an internal audit, one of the most essential is the internal audit report. 
  • What is the Internal Audit Report?
  • The internal audit report is a document containing the format results of the audit. Internal auditors used this internal audit report to display the audit's results, the positive and negative findings, and the conclusions of the auditing process.

    The most important thing to be kept in mind regarding the preparation of the internal audit report is that it must be transparent and impartial, such that the company can deem the audit results beneficial.

  • Lesson Summary

  • Types of Internal Audit
    • Internal Financial Audits: Companies that want to learn more about their audit findings or prepare for an external audit conducted by a third party can perform an internal financial audit.
    • Compliance audits: Companies willing to determine their compliance with local laws and regulations conduct compliance audits
    • Technology and IT Audits: IT audits allow a company to review its hardware, software, controls, system recovery, documentation, security, etc.
    • Construction Audits: Construction audit is common in real estate, development, and construction industries. They perform construction audits to ensure the physical integrity of a building and to perform project billing across the life of their given projects.
    • Environmental Audit: Companies may perform an internal audit to assess their utilization of raw materials, reducing emissions of greenhouse gases and overall energy consumption.
    • Operational Audit: Companies are most likely to perform operational audits when any of their essential figures leaves or when new management replaces the existing one.
    • Performance Audit: During a performance audit, the internal auditor analyzes the outcome of an objective that is not easily countable.

  • What to Avoid while Preparing the Audit Report?
    • Actively identifying any specific party or person who made a mistake.
    • Seeing organizational problems as a whole.
